title_sort: walt whitman to ruth stafford, 11 december 1881
title: Walt Whitman to Ruth Stafford, 11 December 1881
text: CamdenDec: 11 '81Dear RutheyYours rec'dreceived—It seems a friend of mine who is in the Ledger office Philadelphia, tho'tthought I was down at Kirkwood—he was very anxious I should know of the bad illness of a particular friend of mine, & so wrote to Kirkwood—My friend died Friday morning—I go to the funeral to-morrow——I get a little news from you all, once in a while—(by a visit from Ed some time ago—& early last week by a visit from Harry.)—Thank you for the honey—it was very acceptable—we ate every drop of it, & enjoyed it—it was like the singed cat—a great deal better than it look'dlooked——I am well as usual—have a little work to do, but not much—Want to come down & see you all before long—will write a day or two beforeWalt Whitman Walt Whitman to Ruth Stafford, 11 December 1881
